text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Faced with blockage by secessionists (Polisario) on resolving Western Sahara problem, U.N. Security Council must take on the role assigned to it by the peace plan.
- Resumption of Palestinian-Israeli negotiations; PLO worried, Syria pessimistic and Egypt cautious.
- Police officer kills colleague, wounds three in attack blamed on nervous breakdown by sources close to National Security.
- New political party, Democratic Socialist Party, formed, with founding principles of "modern democracy and social justice".
- Cooperation between Moroccan and World Bank intensifies.
- Inquiry continues into disappearance of food supplies donated by World Food Programme to Moroccan schools' canteens.
- Vigorous U.N. protest against Polisario, over efforts to restrict movement of U.N. group in Western Sahara.
